item.title: Swiss Cash Use Drops in Reality Check for Bill-and-Coin Haven
item.description: Swiss Cash Use Declines The use of cash in Switzerland has declined significantly in recent years. In 2017, 70% of all transactions were made in cash. By 2022, that number had fallen to 36%. There are a number of factors that have contributed to the decline in cash use, including the rise of digital payments, the COVID-19 pandemic, and government efforts to reduce tax evasion.
